hypothesis_content.title: XRP Sentiment Divergence Play
hypothesis_content.statement: When XRP experiences extreme negative sentiment (social volume bearish ratio >4:1) but price holds key support levels (≥3% above yearly low), it outperforms BTC by 5-8% over the next 5 days as sentiment normalizes, particularly during neutral regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: XRP's price often decouples from sentiment due to legal/regulatory overhangs. Extreme negative sentiment against technical resilience suggests oversold conditions specific to XRP. The neutral regime filter avoids strong directional markets where sentiment might be justified.
entry_conditions: XRP social sentiment bearish ratio ≥ 4:1 (bearish:bullish mentions)

exit_conditions.take_profit: XRP outperforms BTC by 6% OR sentiment ratio normalizes to <2:1
exit_conditions.stop_loss: XRP breaks yearly low OR underperforms BTC by >4%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If extreme XRP bearish sentiment consistently leads to further underperformance (backtest shows <40% success rate) or if sentiment metrics prove unreliable predictors, hypothesis fails. Must outperform BTC, not just bounce absolutely.
